. . . 
"They still held him." She realized that now.
Captive of an indeterminate prison, he almost stood no chance.

The room stood pitch, but she knew what awaited her. 
She knew he awaited her. 
Not even knowing, yet pleading to be let free.

But whom, or why, she couldn't yet devise.

He could only speak in riddles to remind her of his presence.
Yet she felt them more exactly as soul shaking danger signals as to what would happen if she couldn't reach him in time.

In time for what?

With the hood of her cloak worn low on her brow, the only light seemed to be radiating through
the steadfast yet deeply frightened lady's eyes.

The knife in one hand.  The note in the other,
Lightly clenched, just enough for rough wind to shake her constitution.
Blessedly, the room was still. (But was that him crying or was it her?)
She ventured on.

"Odd, the room smells of Nothing," she thought.
Her foot banged into an object fixed to the floor.
Without a sound, a ceiling trap opened & beaming moonlight drove directly overhead.
Blinking back to adjust, she saw the end.
She stood before an average chair.  Above that, a noose.
She clenched the note tighter this time.

With utmost resolution she shook her head.

"No!" She shouted, craining her neck to the open shaft.
"No! Not this time! I've fought worse! I tried it your way! Why-What else do you ask of me?
No more pain! I have no more to offer you! You have won!"
Barely audible,
She choked back a sob. "We are innocent."
Nothing.
"Let him go."

Another spotlight clicked on to her right. She turned.
It was him. Naked and huddled. But not shaking.

Everything in her told her to run to him. But, mouth agape, she stood immobile.

It was all over for them. He knew that now.
Yet, staring as intently as they were at each other, They both knew something that no one else could ever grasp.

She smiled faintly at him now, turned back and stepped on the chair. She pulled the noose around her neck and jumped. The paper from her outstretched dying hand fluttered to the floor. 
The knife remained in her other hand.

Soon, her twisting ceased. Her body cast an elegant shadow.
The knife pointed directly towards Hades.

The room no longer smelt of Nothing.
There was a strange twinge of Hope.

                   "I never was stranger to you.
                    you know me now, still
                    the knowledge of an old world
                    Reminds me you are near.

                    dance, mon ange
                    in the despairing moonlight
                    I will always fight for you
                    'till breath has left my side

                    A note that reads:
                    'You have slain me.
                    You have exquisitely
                    ruined my life."

He closed his beautiful eyes and smiled contentedly, his flesh rotting away.
He had finished humming.

The lights over both bodies have been shut off.
The song is all but forgotten.
Now and then, you could hear the crows.

1. star trek voyager re-runs are the best! It was the last time star trek captured the real element of fun. Ah, memories. (thanks, spikeTV)

2. the next time some one tells me to "have a nice holiday", I will tell them, "Thank you, can i have your spleen?"

3. That staged shoplifter beat down REALLY sounds better with each passing day.  

4. I wish i could understand more nuanced art. And if i "work on it", won't that just invalidate the point of "nuanced"? 

5.  I forgot how cool my mom's persian pop music tapes were.  Re-discovering "nagoo kia" really is the best thing ever. 

6.  the hysterical child on line at border's yesterday was crying so hard that when he came up for air he sounded colicky.  I felt bad that he could be hurt, but I was glad everyone else was ignoring him. Except that cashier. . . 

7.  I'm really discovering my evil powers. I think i've said too much already.

haven't Seen brian in over a week. we talk every other day. (& send cute as hell texts.) But we both know that's not the same. sigh. Stupid "holidays". his birthday is soon. . .

that tv on the radio "wolf"-something song is good.

gave mel a ride home after HELL the other night. Looks like I'm SOOOO slated to go their this year. 
wow. 4 new year's here already. Almost 4 years living here. wow.

"god smite them, EVERY One!"

New Survey:

dating a very good friend. Good Idea or Landside to immenient desperation?
(note: neither one of us just wants a physical relationship. hell, i don't know what i want.)

Your thoughts?

the Enigma came by the store today. He was pretty chill. Claudio asked for his autograph and he signed him. With puzzle piece. On his wrist. Claudio said he's gonna tattoo it there. 
He's awesome.

Work today went by SUPER-fast. I re-did the women's wall. It is fucking gorgeous. I am seriously proud of it. Everyone should come tomorrow to the Garden State Mall's Hot Topic (lower level, across from the pet store, next to the food court) just to admire the crap outta it. 

After work, i went to Macy's Benefit counter to get some more Hollywood Glo and ended up getting  all dolled up by my new friend Nickala (i'm phonetically spelling her name). She came in to the store once & we chatted about pin-up art. I asked her about her lipstick *NARS something* and since she was wearing a Benefit apron, where the counter for it was. She told me it was at macy's. And that i should visit. So to-day I did. And It was Good. 
I heart Benefit. 

well. nazi-man made me a cd on sunday. So i'm gonna return the insult. (since i kinda refuse to get an ipod, this is how he and i trade music)

much love & smooches,
miss roya of the fucking classy cool iconoclasts (without means).

I am getting married!!
to myself!!
I am soo happy!



I am registered at Manolo Blahnik.

Life is good. Got an assload taken care of today. 
Not mad at smiling nazi mike anymore. Talked to him about the whole theoretically trying to kill me thing. He was sorry. I'm glad he's a grown-up. And that he treats me like one, too.

Finances aren't amazing, but man, are they shaping up.

Maybe i'm supposed to take a trip where there's.  .  . 

[some one else says] Stuff to do?

[i say stoically]Stuff to do. . . stuff to do

both were deee-Vine to-day. thanks for asking. 

looks like another fine evening of air hockey & swimming at my place. go team go!

saving up for vintage dress shoppin' in lil'akron oh! Score!
Hidden Pearl, here I come!

Saw Bauhaus AND Nine Inch Nails last night

Holy Fucking Rock.

Went to the salon right before and got a fierce punk-ish yet glammy look. 
(I heart you, martina!)
I looked SofuckingHot last night. 
mike and i had a blastaroo! i saw jerry and his gf and their posse. alexis, of all people, and her posse. i just saw a lot of people i haven't seen or heard from in ages, it was nice.
but wierd, cause, you know, when i moved out here, one of the major perks was that i didn't know anyone. I mean, it was lonely and sucky, but it was a perk nonetheless.
Ok, well, the show was a religious experience. Like, i felt like how maybe you're supposed to feel after a major blissfully euphoric state of being. i had two strawberry daquris and some people in the row in front of us were smoking the doobage. it was rank, but i got a wicked contact high. 
picked up an autographed Bauhaus cd. sweet. we got cool seats. it was in the center and just close enough not to get sweated on and just far enough away to feel a great breeze when we needed to. blissfully perfect weather. ~sigh~ i FINALLY got to see bauhaus. wicked.

holy fucking rock, that's all i have to say.

YES! Ok, i just got tickets for the Yeah Yeah Yeahs and SONIC YOUTH!!!!!

Sonic FREAKIN Youth!!!!

very happy.
it's in august. 


ok....bye

personal exile again falters. 'tricia finds me via the evil cell phone. 
sushi tuesday night with smiling nazi. *He is dating entirely too much in my opinion* And then telling me about it. He called yesterday to ask my advice for how to answer the online questions of this 27-year old gorgeous attorney from manhattan who travels the world and is 'very outdoorsy'. Anyone else feel inadequate? 
Then went to an uber swank bar with dark purple colors and a nyc-vibe. just us and the bar tender. she was cute. to me, he didn't really think so. talked personal history. I'm kinda getting sick of him. Like, case-in-point, he invites ME out for sushi. so i drive to his place, then he pretty much tried to guilt trip me out in to driving with this pathetic limp, it failed, he drove. But then the check came and it REALLY seemed like mike was expecting me to pay. HA! I took out my half and said, "are we going dutch or what?" That, and the fact he is dating like a loon. 
 Two dating sites and now this 20 year old in hawthorne named laura who reminds me of dana/danielle h. Let me tell YOU how much i think THAT's a great idea. I want him to be happy and settle down like he's all saying he really wants too, but c'MON! 
on the way to Nazi M's, i thought i saw mike g. But i found out later it was Tom.
mike mentioned something about getting a myspace even though he doesn't know what it is.
i almost disowned him as a friend. 
and i know they are all mikes.
apparently there is this tall 20-something named scott who works with my dad. 
"he likes movies."
I know i'm pathetic when my father wants to set me up.
i haven't used make-up in 3 days. chapstick doesn't count.

I still think "the Devil" is a cute idea.

I think I sent a mass text message to everyone I know this morning around 4 am to wish them a happy "wow, americans have too much free time" day. I didn't want to forget.

I need to play the lotto for trip 6's. Just to say, "HA! look!"
It's lame and kitchy. But i do kitch pretty damn well. 

Got the *new* AFI, even though i've had it for what, 3 weeks now? Anyway. I'm lame.
it's beautiful. surprisingly. very rip off of psych. furs & tragically hip. anyway.

it kinda feels like my birthday, you know, i'm all looking forward to this day, & then here it is, but then it's just as fun/crazy/boring/manic/asinine/torturous/humane/bouncy/flirty/toxic/confused/chaotic/predictable/new/wasteful/laughable as most as my days are.
whew.

i got new shoes. they are pretty.
nina, i'll text you a picture of my feet. hold up. ok. there.


nevermind.

by the way, i KNEW math was satan incarnate:

http://users.aol.com/s6sj7gt/mike666.htm

cleaning my room i came across a bit of paper with random things i had written down so i wouldn't forget them (ha). It was from one of those days when i was laying half-dead on my bed watching star trek in the middle of the afternoon on SpikeTV. 
anyway, enough with the expository. 
I was half dead, like i said, and i heard cap'n Picard 
*"Baldy", as my mother affectionately refers to him.* say:

"History has shown us that strength proves useless when faced with terrorism."

And this episode ("the high ground") had to have been from the wee early 90's.
yeah, just a thought.

When the Moz was mouthing off about Joy Division after the fact on a Brit TV show with Joy Division/New Order's manager Rob Gretton, Gretton just patiently waited and said, 
"The fucking trouble with you, Morrissey, is you never had the fucking guts to kill yourself."
And then Prince Melancholy walked off set.

HA. Being amazing, tortured, and adored is one thing.
Being called out on your psuedo-suicidal tendencies on air in your home country, priceless.


it's just like Poiret's tragic flaw, after he was no longer the rage, when he snapped at coco chanel 
(for her designs of practical utility and) for wearing so much black by saying, "Who are you mourning for?"
She merely responded,
"For you, my dear monsieur."

I still think she was an original goth empress, although a kinda Hiltony one.
 
~sigh~ I love it.

You are NEVER as cool as you think you are.

Happy again because I only periodically am an emocidal loony toon.

it's a little chilly, but what a fucking gorgeous day!

I listened to mitch hedberg for a while. Heh. (r.i.p. you awesome man)
I listened to the best psychobilly band to ever grace the planet, The Meteors. 
"IF you don't want to fuck me baby, then Baby, FUCK OFF!"

My fish Buddha is still alive. School was nice to-day. I got an A on my paper. A for AWESOME! 
(i enjoy being a dork.)

Happy Belated B-day, Mel. HOOT! I only hate you sometimes, Heh heh.
Only Sometimes.

even though I haven't had lunch or anything really resembling breakfast, I'm making muffins.
(i heart sexual inuendo) But i really am baking muffins. Multiberry just-add-water muffins. . .  .

MUFFINS!

On my way through the parking lot last night, there was a raw steak on the asphalt.
This isn't me trying to sound poetic. 
There was a fucking steak on the ground.
A whole one. out of the package.
At first, i thought, "ew. a dead animal." but then, upon closer examination-
I laughed because, man, someone threw out a perfectly respectable steak in the middle of a parking deck.
It was really cold last night, so As it was all bloody, the blood stayed red and kept the steak juicy and not "leaky". Completely abandoned by bugs. Thus far.
I walked away and then turned back around & took a picture with my cell. 
Made my night.

Mother has called you among the Beautiful begging for fingertips that freeze where you stand.
I drowned about a week ago. You whetted my appetite for mountains that fall below the trees where you rained sulfur. 
Catch something and deprive it of water.
ecstatic to be rid of your pastry that weighs more than it's worth.
Don't choke because it isn't required to see black sand blind you.
A curly haired beauty who drapes her sorrows like bleach.
whiskey isn't spelled that way.
use your toes to cut me off.
Use your toes to cut me off.
he Desires her less.

He desires her less.

Shame and cowardice 
are evidence enough
without a ploy you borrowed from someone else 
in line
though, i think
i should've at least seen the brick flying at my face
this time.

a sparrow in the rough winds.
treacherous, a friend.
chapped lips upon a grave- 
pretend.

little dove, where is your home?
Sparrow girl. where will you go now?
the winds go no further east before
you turn 'round again.

I am continuously trapped.
la sparrow
lost
fluttering with a broken wing on frozen street in the big city.
the lights remind you of god.
ever filled by dread
pedantic mental state
ridiculous and dead.

Sparrow girl, alone in the world.
feathers ruffled by ordinary flights of fancy
time is against you.
time destroys hope and forgiveness.
time to think transparently.
time will only deliver me
painfully.

i was a wonton weed.
ready for flowering.
i was wanting to thank you.
for letting me in. 
thank you for having me indulgently, invitingly, confused.
i would want to thank you for your drug induced happiness,
smile to save your rainy days.
but you pulled away too soon.

do not confuse me with your
ordered chaos.
you will make no mistake by me.
you will fly no more to the mountains of monaco.
you never told a lie and never told the truth
you think it is i whom love does not avow.
you have said what i knew you would say:
"you are rendered useless to me now."

oh yeah.
After class tuesday, i got rear-ended.
My car did, smartass, when i was in it.

my back still hurts

but i did have a dream about a week ago that a non-sexual non scary vamp bit my neck while i was sleeping, and when i woke up, the right side of my neck to about my shoulder hurt.

So my sub-conscious knew i put something outta whack, but Me, awake, didn't.

No, i didn't actually believe a vampire bit me.

Last night, i was really sick. ended up chatting online between headaches.
then i got an AMAZING phone call:

that Scorpio guy i met last time @ the waterbug calls me and BOOKS me for two shows.
Yes. I got BOOKED for my poetry. 
I so win.


This thursday is my promo. I'm opening for another poet to promote my show. Then the Thursday after that, i'm headlining:

Thursday 29th.
5-8pm
@ Urban Medley
591 Summit St.
Jersey City.

$3 cover.

yes, bitches, i'm getting the proceeds.

Come to jersey and give me money. . . er. . . "support"

Ooohh...travelzoo says i can go to Paris for a weekend getaway for 400 bucks. ~sigh~ sounds reallllly nice.
Nice sounds nice, too. 

cliche, i know. 




shut up.

HAPPY FREAKING BIRTHDAY TO ITZAK PERLMAN!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

God amongst mere violinist virtuosos. When you hear him play an arrangement, you KNOW that's the way it is supposed to sound. 

Thank you for existing. 

Rock on.

note to self:

today, i was stalked by a super-creepy ooollddd man. he ruined my lunch break and he fucked with my chi. 
Thankfully & at the very least, i know my co-workers were looking out for me. Thanks guys! lots of smilies.

too tired to really type anything worth reading. give me a bit.

Ohio (and implied trip) was beyond Fun-derdome. Stow hasn't changed much in a year. 
I really did forget how beautiful it is out there, though.
kinda sealed that whole *i don't belong here* thing.


i can say this much. You get what you ask for, but not necessarily what you want. 



A lady reveals nothing.

Yo. Ok, wow. Tonight was FUCKING AMAZING. i will update. And update *hopefully* with photos, later.

I love you, monika. Sleep well, earth angel.

G'Nite Moon!!!

New Jersey has saturated me.
I'm "on line" not in it.
I never drink pop, but will have the occasional "soda".
Nothing is similar or true, but always "RiGHt??" with an incredulous tone.
There is no such thing as a virgin, you are just to ugly to fuck.
A celibate is someone who has gone a week without sex.
I'm looking at 10 months, What the hell does that make me?
Patience is actually a virtue. And believe it or not, I have been thanked for having it.
IT is not New York City. IT is THE city.
If it is not in THE city, or (and why can't they spell it  right?!?) the fucking "boro" where I live or work, I barely have heard mention of where you are from.
Regardless that it might have been where I was originally from.
Because I now don't have any clue where I came from.


Sad, isn't it? "Stow" is now what it has always been in the english language, Verb for a place to put away something. Gosh, that's dismally prophetic.

Isn't it?

Hello.

I have a massive headache.
People in small rooms on sweltering summer nights should not smoke.
Really, no one should smoke. Do we Really need to feed Big -American- Brother?
I think not.
Thank God or whatever I know I'm a hypocrite.

Good-bye.

working more, playing more. Saturday, worked an awful long shift, came home, made a birthday card. Monika's 31st birthday party was saturday. I went. We hadn't seen each other for a year. Everyone was at least 30. Most were married and brought their kids. Yeah. I belonged. Not. Had a beer, homemade Polish food, and good champagne. Nice. Got hit on by married dudes who were drunk and trying to piss off their wives. Nice. More like, super Icky. Oh right, my ex-boss from Barnes and Noble was there. (her husband reminded me of the "nice smart little chinese boy" i went to highschool with, you know, the one who grows up to be this fantastic AssHole?) Awesome. I don't think she really remembered me, but c'mon, how many "Roya's" could she have hired in the past year? So tired, i called kevin back after i realized i was going to be the butt of the "she's the youngest and strangest looking one here, let's be pricks" jokes at the party/get together for people who are REALLY BORING. Anyway, kev and i talked, realized lauren and co. would be doing something later(i've been hanging out with her again, WEE!!! ~smiles~) and i was like, ok, call me when that shit all goes down. Yeah, so i got home and sooo tucker'd out by the days events (and i think, the champagne) i fell asleep. Got about 80 voicemails asking where the fuck i was. yeah, should probably return a few of those. Nah. And why did EveryonE call me Saturday? I mean, WTF? Payday is FRIDAY, you dumbfucks. I felt all loved and popular and then sunday morning, NOTHING. You all suck. At least i got in a sober conversation with jon before i left for monika's. Today, i get an extra shift at work. That enough of an update for you? the end.

last night, 'Tricia and i went to the city to see Trigonis' new film. he's this really awesome guy i've met a few times at different open mics and his plays and he's a friend of patricia's. ~anyway~ to say it was raining cats and dogs really doesn't give the adequate picture as to how shitty it was out last night. ESPECIALLY walking around nyc where there are fjords and bottomless moats everywhere and the cabs make a game of hitting these "puddles"(ha.) to splash the already bone-soaked pedestrians. Yeah, it sucked. AND Trig is directionally challenged. I got to meet this cool hippie, though. he was funny. very stoned. Soooo we finally got a cab after walking for about an hour in the hellish piss storm. yeah, we were late but the films were really worth it. Here boys, I'm plugging ya:

www.nothingmanfilms.com

got to see the last half of "John Mellon". which is really too hilarious for words. this guy goes on an office killing spree and all his co-workers are watermellons. it's very Atom-film. but really funny.

But wow and a half, "Cunnigula" is fucking great. Armed with a not yet released sleep inducer(SOM-Patch), man goes on a blind cunnilingus rampage on the women in the city. all the usual, um, exploits ensue. And some that you really wish didn't. I haven't laughed that hard in a while. I swear to god, John Trigonis is an AMAZING writer. I barely recognized the lead actor, and i've met him a few times before. soo, that was hilarious. 

Nina, you'll love this...remember that cool looking theatre in the village advertising that doc about Judy Garland in front? yeah, that's where these two gems debuted. wicked, right? 
yeah, would've if the rain wasn't pouring in buckets.

anyway, since i took the path (path train) from jersey city, and 'tricia parked elsewhere...it was around midnite when i made it back to my car. i don't like jersey city when i'm alone at night....it's sccaarrryyy. Still pissed we couldn't have just met in the village and took a cab to the random address trigonis gave. ~anyway~ life goes on.

A rant:

Hey boy! where did I fail in giving you inaction? your style is hardly striking. A 1960's cry-for-help. or is that plagiary? yeah. . .that. And the 13 dollars in your precociously torn jean's pocket. how much more will you steal from women before all the men dick you over too? how i wish i could take back all the apologies i made for thinking you were worthless the first time. I ran 42 city blocks and you still kissed my ass. how IS my ex? I know she's a virgin. don't worry. she fucked me up first. 10 years from the day I last regret talking to you will I be ready to see you tell me you missed all our conversations and my company. you really did know me better than anyone. so why did you fail so miserably at being human? I do miss the old you. stealing spoons and giving me a scary drive up a step hill, icy in your death-trap truck on my birthday. I should have probably identified you as what you are: an ass in sheep's clothing. 
My one true love? you can't possibly live up to the image i have forsaken lovers and tormented myself with of you. swimming blond in that frozen river in my head. if i saw you today, it would probably ruin it. your simple name. your simple heart. 
My oldest friend? don't worry. I never wanted to ruin it. daisy fields in a city with raining hypocrites far from both of us. I have known you & been remembered too long. Your ebony skin is a constant reminder of beauty. thank you for you. a saving grace in this haphazard wasteland. 
I barely remember you. and i wish i could. you looked good in my jewlery and my optimism. a teenage Adonis. still in love with Magic. . .gathering groupies wasn't your forte. i've always coveted the underdog. that was the last pure memory of a crush i ever had. . .blue eyes almost see-through. 
The one night stand, presidential suite of a 2-star hotel. . .I'm stuck, 15 years old and covered in postage stamps. they were only 29 cents then. stupid football player with stupid green eyes and sandy hair that blinded me and taught me what tounges are for. Must be why i loathe myself in khakis. 
I wrote you letters. You wrote lies. because we were 12 and the only ones stranded and not interested in suicide yet. But drug lords captured your bishop even though i was your Brunette Virgin Queen. not yet defiled and almost completely brainwashed. too bad i never really knew you. did you finally change your name back? 
And you boring boy, I did give my heart only to you. I really never gave you enough credit for slowing me down. you called me graceful, i called it clumsy. the sky was blue. too dull to rain. all we needed was a good wash-out. call it a day. you called yourself a monster yesterday. please believe i forgive you and not myself. about yesterday. . .you never scared me, only made me scare myself. i don't want to be like our parents. these are charred memories of lilies and the notion that you forgot I've never pierced my ears. 
More neglect than I've patience for. Possibly Maybe, at any rate. 
Thanks for letting me fall on my face, for you. when i think of home, i have you. when i remember life. i can forget you. and your name. because that's apparently all i have now. a shoebox with your name all over it.

i know i'm not depressed. but i'm not really in that tier known as happyness either. God, i love the cars. 

oohh. oh! so i went to my friend tiffany's b-day party in jersey city last night. she's actually punk rock. regardless of whatever definition you're using. and her "friends", while sweet as hell and nice, are fucking pretentious as all get out. the topics were actually "punk rock politics". yea.

needless to say i was choking on the irony.

and i'll tell you why. it's so sad, really. this one guy was really an educated guy, and this other girl was young but full of sweet naivete, i really hope she never loses that. one of tiffany's other friends reminded me of nina. like, she looks like how i remember nina looks close up. but i REALLY wanted to punch this girl in the face. she wouldn't let anyone get a word in, and then was really something of a. . . know-it-all? even though she didn't know very much of anything. which, thankfully, someone besides me called her on. i mean, i did say, i didn't think she knew what she was talking about. because, um, she didn't. she was also one of those people who takes credit for EVERYTHING, and then really violates people's personal space, like, she would talk IN YOUR FACE and AT you, instead of TO you. maybe she was drunk. anyway. i did, however, meet this older(like, i think everyone was around 24) couple, maybe mid-thirties, couple. who, i happen to think, have been living the punk life. drunk, happy, and damning the man. go figure. she could dance and had the fucking best attitude. telling this one guy to shut up and laughing at everyone, with everyone...same thing. i'm glad there are people like her out there.  everyone was all anti this, anti that...and some good points were made but i thought it was hilarious that i was hanging out with people i thought had a clue. but realized they are just as mentally deficient as the people i talk to on a daily basis. Like, the whole scene reminded me of a set from SLC punk. maybe it was the lighting, i don't know. the fact that they were equally as pretentious as the Hot topic crew kinda leveled out the playing field for me. i think i'm going hang out with just hip hop people now. they seem to be the most friendly. and if you are stupid to them, they are at least willing to teach. without making you feel like a moron. I like hip hop people.

there is something to be said of trying to sound witty at 3:30 in the morning. you think you sound somewhat slightly more intelligent and philisophical than you usually are but that, i think, is because your brain is processing slightly less than it does when you have had proper/adequate sleep. i'm about to brush my hair and go to six brothers(diner). i think i had a nightmare and that's why i'm awake but i don't know. anything i say right now is just the ramblings of anyone after they unpleasantly wake up. i'm not hungry. or thirsty, but i just drank the last of the cran-grape. i loathe cran-grape. and i added water so it wouldn't be as harsh on my throat as it went down. but that never works. i'm cold now. have a mini-afghan draped over my shoulders but it's a half-assed attempt of fending off the cold air i let in through the window i left a little open because my room was at one time last night too hot. the weather is never perfect. there is always someone complaining about it. if i'm cold now, why would i think going to a diner is going to make me feel better? that place is always too fucking cold. everything is too fucking cold in jersey. i'm including people.

(untitled) for jonathan.

I'm only marginally interested in your perverse addiction to flushing your heart down in to all the wrong people. The ones you've said you never waited to become invested in. The ones you've said you wished you never used. The ones you've said all that shit you've ever said. No one walks alone. There's always a constant reminder of those you so blindly call a mistake and never come to terms with why you fell in the first place. pooling together those drought of feelings. . . fucked off and disastrous? a whisper that smells like sex. It has the unmistakable stench of a lie. Maybe for all the hard times, grand times, the times where you fell and fended off imaginary demons. You lonely little liar. de-pantsed and depraved. starving, blindly for attention. all those women to straighten you out. all those stupid songs you pretend to know. safe from the wintry burning. lessening the salt waves crashing about and wounding no one. 
Black merriweathers fluster because I invited you in for more than entertainment. Mother Specter from the third apocalypse; I am shrinking, drinking in more pain than tolerable. Miserable, putting my hands to my face, scratching trenches so the short salt tears will burn bloody in effigy. a reminder that "nothing means anything". A disastrous mourner, dark lonesome angels hiding. In times of rationale; it's all over for you. The End- the deep end, the living end, the bitter end. You with your sickening sticky sweet words that pronounce less than rudimentarly you have nothing interesting to say. you toss around emotions like a dog and his bowel movements, and even he has a sense of loyalty. Dancing around half truths that you are half ready to be a good person. shivering from death, memorized metamorphosis. staring up because "some people don't deserve to get diseased." but, honey, you do. Things happen at the right time for you, or they're meaningless-just like you. It's a beautiful freedom that nothing's more clever than getting kicked in the teeth. Almost as bad for me as those damn cookies that pock your face and soul. black & white
-and- split just like your personality. And When you are ready? 
Anytime you feel wonderful, remember me. 
When you see what makes you smile. . . - Remember, "For you, everything."
A division of time between the here -and- the now
drunken admissions of well wishings.
Excuse me for not having Myself memorized. I Never promised promiscuity. 
How's that right hand doing?
At least you're happy.
